1. "The Bedroom" by Vincent van Gogh (1888) - This painting is one of Van Gogh's most famous works, and it's part of the Art Institute of Chicago's collection. It depicts the bedroom of Van Gogh's house in Arles, France, and it's characterized by its bold, vibrant colors and thick brushstrokes.
2. "Wheat Field with Cypresses" by Vincent van Gogh (1889) - This painting is another well-known work by Van Gogh, and it's also part of the Art Institute of Chicago's collection. It depicts a wheat field with a group of cypress trees in the background, and it's characterized by its swirling, expressive brushstrokes and bold, contrasting colors.
3. "The Starry Night" by Vincent van Gogh (1889) - This painting is one of Van Gogh's most famous works, and it's part of the Art Institute of Chicago's collection. It depicts the view from the east-facing window of his asylum room at Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, just before sunrise, with the stars of the night sky still visible in the sky.
